topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a49c876368722b7d001824#post_55a49c876368722b7d001824

[spoiler]I know this is a stupid idea when you think of it but maybe this is a prototype the main computers still can't quite reproduce. Think of it, meshing flesh _with_ machine is something that never happens in Terminator (I'm sure that concept was explored in the Expanded Universe at some point, I just know). We've had machines disguised as people but no one was ever converted. Therefore, this being their first attempt at doing so is more like a field test to see if it's a viable option to produce more.[/spoiler]

topics.body:
"@ToskiHero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a49d3d6368721121001c7e#post_55a49d3d6368721121001c7e
Pretty much.

The lore behind terminator doesn't make any fucking sense when you think about it.

The best way to get rid of humans if you're skynet would be to develop nanobots that use any components to assimilate organic matter and deploy it in the upper atmosphere.  There would literally be nothing that humans could do against that because A)you would effectively globally convert all humans into terminators B)you wouldn't know about it until you were already assimilated.


No offense to any fans of these franchises, but it's why when you think about it Cybermen, Terminators, Reapers, the Borg have their heads up their asses.  If you were to create nanites that assimilates organic components and spray it in a planets atmosphere what could you do to stop your planet from being assimilated?  Fucking nothing that's what.

Even if you didn't have the technology to assimilate the entire organism assimilating everything except the nervous structure and enhancing it with neural enhancements and controlling it with a secondary memory to overwrite the organic memory's priority would be doable with nanites.

"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a49ceb63687266c5000578#post_55a49ceb63687266c5000578
According to the best friends there's an unutilized plot line where sky net after years of killing the shit out of people goes "wait...why am I doing this again?" And essentially manufactures John Connor's heroic identity to use him as sort of a loophole for its inability to self terminate. 

Which sounds kind of convoluted until you think about the fact that if an ai had decided to kill everyone but suddenly went "okay I'm done, kill me" you would be suspicious as fuck
